meanings.definition: To leap or jump farther or higher than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit outleaps the turtle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The athlete outleaps his competitors in the long jump.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo outleaps the squirrel in a hopping contest.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outleaps any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The superhero outleaps tall buildings in a single bound.

meanings.definition: To surpass in leaping or jumping.
meanings.sent1: The frog outleaps the fish in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The deer outleaps the fence effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The grasshopper outleaps its shadow in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm outleaps his physical abilities.
meanings.sent5: The gazelle outleaps its predators with grace.
